label: 大仏開眼会
対訳語: Consecration Ceremony of the Great Buddha
本: Exhibition of Shōsō-in Treasures , The 57th  . Nara National Museum . 2005
説明文: The eye-opening" ceremony for the Great Vairocana (J:Rushana) Buddha of Tōdaiji, held on the ninth day of the fourth month of 752. The first ritual of its kind in Japan, it was conducted on command of Emperor Shōmu and Empress Kōmyō, its chief participants, in addition to the senior clergy who advised the imperial couple. This lavish ceremony was attended by one thousand priests and one hundred civil and military officials. Many of the objects used at the ritual are still kept in the Shōsō-in，including ornaments from the headdresses worn by of Emperor Shōmu and Empress Kōmyō; brushes, ink sticks,and silk ropes used for drawing in the pupils on the eyes of the Great Buddha; gigaku dance masks and dance costumes; ornaments; and objects donated by the aristocracy. [東大寺、聖武天皇、光明皇后、正倉院、伎楽]"
